meanings.definition: The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period.
meanings.sent1: Different regions have different climates, some are hot and others are cold.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study climates to understand patterns in weather over time.
meanings.sent3: The desert climate decided to take a vacation to the Arctic.
meanings.sent4: Her warm personality created a climate of kindness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The unpredictable climate of the rainforest kept explorers on their toes.

meanings.definition: The prevailing trend of public opinion or of another aspect of life.
meanings.sent1: In today's political climate, many people are divided on important issues.
meanings.sent2: The social climate of the school was welcoming and inclusive.
meanings.sent3: The fashion climate decided that socks with sandals were the new trend.
meanings.sent4: His speech changed the climate of the meeting from tense to relaxed.
meanings.sent5: The economic climate of the country affected businesses in various ways.
